frame.name: Motion_directional
frame.definition:
<def-root>In this frame a <fen>Theme</fen> moves in a certain <fen>Direction</fen> which is often determined by gravity or other natural, physical forces. The <fen>Theme</fen> is not necessarily a self-mover.
<ex> <fex name="Theme">The paper</fex> <t>fell</t> <fex name="Path">to the floor</fex>.</ex> <ex> <fex name="Theme">The girl</fex> <t>dropped</t> <fex name="Distance">13 stories</fex> <fex name="Result">to her death</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Area
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the general <fen>Area</fen> in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path.
<ex>Soot-contaminated snow <t>falls</t> <fex name="Area">in Slovakia's mountainous regions</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies any <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing the the state of the <fen>Theme</fen> during the motion.</def-root>

FE.name: Distance
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Distance</fen> identifies a phrase that characterizes the extent of motion of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>The student <t>plunged</t> from a road bridge <fex name="Dist">more than 100 feet</fex> to his death.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Duration</fen> is used for the length of time for which the Motion takes place.
<ex>In one storm , 46 inches of rain <t>fell</t> <fex name="Dur">in 24 hours</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Goal</fen> is the location the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up in (often unintentionally).
<ex>The rivals both <t>fell</t> backwards <fex name="Goal">into empty space</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the Motion takes place.
<ex>A few heavy spots of rain <t>fell</t> on the pavement <fex name="Mnr">like coins</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Path</fen> refers to (a part of) the ground over which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels or to a landmark past which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels.
<ex>The boys <t>plummeted</t> <fex name="Path">down the stairs</fex> into the basement.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Speed
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Speed</fen> at which the motion occurs.
<ex>Michelle <t>toppled</t> <fex name="Spd">slowly</fex> to the floor.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the Motion occurs.
<ex><fex name="Time">In 1977</fex> Nigel <t>plunged</t> to his death in his car on a mountain road in southern France.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Carrier
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Carrier</fen> is the means of conveyance of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>Nigel <t>plunged</t> to his death <fex name="Car">in his car</fex> on a mountain road in southern France.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Theme</fen> is the entity that changes location.
<ex>In 1977, <fex name="Thm"> Nigel</fex> <t>plunged</t> to his death in his car on a mountain road in southern France.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> is the location the <fen>Theme</fen> occupies before the Motion occurs. <ex>The man <t>toppled</t> <fex name="Src">from the passenger seat</fex> into the road.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Result</fen> of the motion.
<ex>Marie shoved Simon, and he <t>toppled</t> <fex name="Result">over</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where motion specified by <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen> occurs. <ex><fex name="Place">In the kitchen</fex>, the towel <t>dropped</t> onto the floor.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Theme</fen> crosses boundary as it enters a <fen>Goal</fen> region or exits a <fen>Source</fen> region.
<ex>Sucking in a deep breath, he <t>plunged</t> <fex name="Degree">fully</fex> into the cold water</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Point_of_contact
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE is used for expressing some part of the <fen>Theme</fen> participant that makes contact with a horizontal surface.
<ex>With a loud thump, the monster <t>fell</t> <fex name="poi">on its back</fex>, the earth trembling as he hit the ground.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Path_shape
FE.definition: <def-root>The shape formed by the path followed by the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An event whereby the motion of the <fen>Theme</fen> comes about.</def-root>

FE.name: Direction
FE.definition:
<def-root>The direction of motion of the <fen>Theme</fen>. <fen>Direction</fen> characterizes the <fen>Path</fen> of motion according to some system of orientation, most often that imposed by gravity.
<ex>I hope your egg does n't <t>fall</t> <fex name="dir">down</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>Any state of affairs or event from which the particular direction motion logically follows.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of affairs that the agentive <fen>Theme</fen> hopes to bring about by moving in a particular direction.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of the world as the action occurs.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: plummet.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fall or drop straight down at high speed.

lexUnit.name: fall.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move from a higher to a lower level, typically rapidly and without control

lexUnit.name: plunge.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fall or move suddenly and uncontrollably.

lexUnit.name: descend.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move downward due to a physical force such as gravity

lexUnit.name: rise.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move in an upward direction

lexUnit.name: dip.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to proceed downwards due to a physical force

lexUnit.name: angle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move at an angle (linear incline in comparison to some point)

lexUnit.name: slant.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to lean in one direction
